intro: Galium ghilanicum, commonly known as the Ghilan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium ghilanicum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
